DOCNAME: CASE OF KÖKSAL AND DURDU v. TURKEY
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in GPE and GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was discharged from his civil service post following his previous criminal conviction by a martial law court . The conviction had been finalised by ORG decision of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought an action before ORG to annul the discharge order .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant 's request .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG . The written opinions of the public prosecutor and of the judge rapporteur ( “ tetkik hakimi ” ) concerning his appeal request were not communicated to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's request for rectification of its previous decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was discharged from his civil service post after a disciplinary decision . Criminal proceedings were also commenced against the applicant on the same grounds as those which had led to his discharge .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant brought an action before ORG to annul the discharge order .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the applicant of the offences with which he had been charged . On DATE ORG upheld the applicant 's acquittal .

CARDINAL . NORP In the meantime , on DATE ORG refused the applicant 's request to annul the discharge order . Relying on LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL ) , the administrative court held that the applicant 's acquittal of the criminal charges did not absolve him from the disciplinary sanction .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of ORG . The written opinions of the public prosecutor and of the judge rapporteur concerning his appeal request were not communicated to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's rectification request . The final decision was served on the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law can be found in the case of GPE v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
